result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica L Mann was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jessica L Mann in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Judge Habeck appears via video from Shawano County. Called at 11:34 AM. Court has plea questionnaire and reviews that the defendnat would be pleading G to both counts on 15CF76 and all counts on 15CF187, counts #1, #2 and #3. Court does verbal collaquey regarding him appearing via video. State agrees with questionnaire as read by Court. Court goes thru the DEJ requirements/rules. Court goes thru plea questionnaire, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her constitutional rights by entering her pleas, accepts plea, finds G on count #2 on 15CF76 and all counts on 15CF187 (Counts #1, #2 and #3), withholds finding of guilt on count #1 on 15CF76 and accepts Deferred Prosecution Agreement and its conditions. Defendant understands what she is pleading to. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation and looks to Ms. Burns to recite. Burns - 15CF187 - count #1 is to be DRI. Court dismisses and reads in that count and goes over what that means with the defendant and does not find her G of that count as previoulsy stated. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation of withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years with standard conditions of probation of costs, no alcohol, AODA and asks that the court not assess DNA surcharges on all counts. State - up to the Court. Court - it will be a DNA surcharge on one count only on each case. Defendant makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 on 15CF76 - accepts Deferred Prosecution Agreement and its conditions; on all counts - withhold sentence and place on probation for 2 years, concurrent to each other, with conditions of: $10.00 fine plus costs on each count - take bond posted and remainder due thru probation - only one DNA surcharge on each case (count #1 on 15CF187), standard conditions, submit DNA sample, 21 days credit on 15CF76 if revoked and counsel to file a stipulation for credit on 15CF187 and would consider full time treatment as credit towards sentence, right to appeal, adjourned at 11:57 AM.
faxed bond sheet to Jessica at the # she requested
No consumption of alcohol. Removes the condition of returning to jail once treatment is completed.
to signature bond per stip & order
Plea hearing on May 10, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Plea hearing on April 21, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
Progress report from Gookomis Endaad for defendant
Plea hearing on April 8, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Jessica L Mann in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:25 PM. Burns - resolved - it is going to be a DEJ and that is not prepared, asking for an adjournment for stated reasons, in agreement with Court appearing via video. All parties are in agreement with that. Court continues bond on both cases. Burns wants to address bond - makes argument for the defendant to stay on a signture bond on 15CF187 instead of going back to a cash bond once released from treatment. Court reads what current bond is on 15CF187. State - bond - if cases ends before her treatment is up, bond will not be an issue. All parties agree. Clerk and JA will get a PLEAS via video (Judge Habeck) prior to 5/8/16.

ADDRESS INFO for Jessica L Mann
Current: P.O.Box 855, c/o Gerald Mann, Lac du Flambeau, WI 54538 United States  (Effective: 03-29-2016)
Prior: 5110 Strawberry Drive, Crandon, WI 54520

No consumption of alcohol and the defendant is released on this signature bond to attend inpatient treatment in Lac du Flambeau and then the bond switches back to the original cash bond once treatment is completed or if she leaves without completing treatment or if the defendant posts $2000.00 cash.

Defendant Jessica L Mann in court with attorney Mary L. Roth Burns.  Defendant Jessica L Mann in custody.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:27  Aso called 15CF187. State - here on a waiver of PH on 15CF187 and status on 15CF76. Burns and Mann agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived her right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Burns has Information, waives reading of it, pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts pleas, continues bond on both matters and set both matters for FPT. Burns addresses the bond on 15CF187 and an issue of getting the defendant into a residential treatment facility, asking that bond on that case be changed to signature bond. State - bond - no objections to the treatment but wants to make sure the defendant would still be available for the pre-trial date. Burns responds - believes she will be. Court - bond - reduces bond to $2000.00 signature bond for her to attend inpatient treatment in Lac du Flambeau and then the bond switches back to the original cash bond once treatment is completed or if she leaves without completing treatment or if the defendant posts $2000.00 cash.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 11:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jessica L Mann in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Jessica L Mann in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:56 AM. State instructs Court that the defendant has other pending matters in front of Judge Habeck. Burns has not gone over the complaint yet with the defendant as she just recently received it. Mann has complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Burns and Mann understand charges and penalties. Court continues bond, sets for PH.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:00 pm.
